title: While changing profiles, sed Profile wont open and said a Error Message
content:
When i was changing Profiles, Firefox said an error message "Using an older version of Firefox can corrupt bookmarks and browsing history already saved to an existing Firefox profile. For your protection, create a new profile for this installation of Firefox"

Its my first time using Firefox and I'm very Worried. I have a lot of data and bookmarks on that profile. I have 2 types of Firefox, Normal Firefox (Version 91.0.2 64-bit) and Firefox Dev Edition (Version 92.0b9 (32-bit) Normal Firefox for Browsing and Dev Edition for coding. When i was trying to use the Profile in Dev Edition (Pre-made in Normal Firefox) it worked. But when i was trying to use the profile that i used on Dev Edition it doesn't work. Then i was forced to make a new profile.

Can anyone solve this problem? I've never Updated Firefox because i downloaded in Version 91.0.2
creator: stevenalexander1308

title: Can't change my username from alysenet1 to alysenet; I think I'm alysenet too
content:
I am going through a project now to update my email address in my hundreds of online profiles... all because I'm changing email service (from earthlink to a combo of icloud and mailfence) and am anal about updating my records/profiles. I'm also trying to clean up any multiple-account/multiple-username type situations I'm coming across. My Firefox account email address update is making some issues surface. Here's what's happened . . .

So far, on mozilla.org, I was able to change my alysenet@earthlink.net email address to alysenet@icloud.com wherever that field is in my profile. I can't recall what my USERNAME was for that case. I THINK, somewhere along the way, I also DELETED my "alysenet@earthlink.net" account on mozilla.org, though I wouldn't bet my life on it. All I know is:

1. I'm able to LOG IN aok to mozilla.org using alysenet@icloud.com and a password. Yay!

2. BUT . . . ANNOYING: I am seeing that when I get onto mozilla.org (such as on a Firefox Forum Support page) using alysenet@icloud.com and my password, the upper right part of the screen shows "alysenet1" not plain vanilla alysenet.

3. AND . . . ANNOYING...and what I'm trying to SOLVE is: When I go into my alysenet@icloud.com profile and try to CHANGE my username from alysenet1 to alysenet, I get a "username already taken" message.

I think MAYBE the "username already taken" is due to *MY* originally having an alysenet@earthlink.net account and maybe the system still considers it "active" even though I (am pretty sure) I *deleted* my Firefox alysenet@earthlink.net account on 07-26-2021.

Would the system say "username already taken" even if I was the one who had that username and deleted that account? Dunno if that's what's going on; I'm trying to understand what's going on.

BOTTOM LINE: Can you please:

(1) look into whether the "alysenet" as well as "alysenet1" were/are BOTH *ME*Â ??? Alyse Simon, in San Diego? If you need additional identification to make sure that "alysenet1" and not just alysenet, is Me, just let me know what you'd like to know.

(2) fix the system so I can change my username from alysenet1 to alysenet?

Thanks.
creator: alysenet1

title: Dark mode is ignored for a moment when opening new tab (Especially youtube)
content:
Hi!

  • I have dark mode enabled both on my windows and Linux partition (in Gnome).
  • I am also logged in to my google account on YouTube.
  • This problem comes up when visiting websites but I notice it especially on YouTube.

When I navigate to YouTube in a new tab, while loading, the light mode flashes for a moment until the dark mode is engaged. This bright flash is painful as I have to readjust my vision for a moment before the dark mode loads.

How do I get Firefox to render the dark mode directly instead of giving me this bright flash? It seems to me like it's a caching issue, that it caches the light mode. When I just started to use Firefox it did not have this problem and would load the dark mode instantly.

Thank you in advance.
creator: khvjohansson

title: Open all synced tabs
content:
Hello everyone, I have always been a fan of the sync feature. i have 3 devices i use everyday with my tabs open between all of them. now, just recently i switched to linux and ported over my 500+ open tabs using the sync feature by just clicking "Open all taps" button. while playing around i missed up the os and had to reinstall it. now i am here in firefox looking at my synced tabs little window and there is no "open all tabs" button anymore. where did it get moved to? i looked everywhere and i couldn't find it. i cant just spend two or so hours opening all my tabs manually...

Thank you for your time.
creator: waelother12
